intro: Vangueria spirostylis, commonly known as the spiral-styled vangueria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of stamens in its flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, simple, and usually hairy leaves. Its small, white or yellowish flowers are clustered in cymes, and it produces small, round berries that are edible. Vangueria spirostylis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in semi-arid environments.
